page.title: 09BUILDINGS - SULLINGTON
page.content: {Greyfriars Lane Area} A building of interest in Sullington is The Abbey, which was originally a large mansion, the central part of which was restored for use as a Rectory in 1621. The carved front door has a panel bearing the date 1623. The house later passed into private hands, and in 1953 became a school run by the Dominican sisters. The Smugglers' Hut was restored some years ago, but still retains the original chimney and old beams. There is a large passage under the house, giving rise to speculation that it was once a depot for goods smuggled across the Downs from the coast.
